verses.text: Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and shun evil.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:1–12
rsbNotes.text: 3:1–12 These verses are probably a single unit of instruction, with the typical “my son” address repeated in v. 11. The unit contains the usual imperatives (vv. 1, 3, 5–7, 9, 11) and motivating clauses (vv. 2, 4, 8, 10). Verse 12 explains the purpose of the Lord’s discipline, encouraging the wise to follow the precept of v. 11.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:7
rsbNotes.text: 3:7 wise in your own eyes. The phrase summarizes the idea that the human mind with its intellect and reason is independently capable of reaching a true understanding of reality, without any dependence upon God’s revelation.

verses.text: This will bring health to your body and nourishment to your bones.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 3:8
rsbNotes.text: 3:8 True wisdom is life-affirming in the most practical ways.
